net.homeip.donaldm.httpdbase4j
Class FileStringTemplateHandler

java.lang.Object
  net.homeip.donaldm.httpdbase4j.StringTemplateHandler
      net.homeip.donaldm.httpdbase4j.FileStringTemplateHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
HttpHandleable, Postable, Templatable
public class FileStringTemplateHandler
extends StringTemplateHandler
implements HttpHandleable, Postable, Templatable

Handler for StringTemplate requests from a local filesystem.

Author:
Donald Munro
See Also:
StringTemplateHandler, Templatable

onIsCacheable

public boolean onIsCacheable(long id,
                             com.sun.net.httpserver.HttpExchange ex,
                             Request request)
Called to determine whether the resource from a request should be cached. To implement user defined cacheing cache the file but return false and also overide @see onGetCachedFile to return the cached file.

Specified by:
onIsCacheable in interface HttpHandleable
Parameters:
id - Unique id
ex - The exchange instance for the current HTTP transaction.
request - The request instance
Returns:
true to cache the result, false to not cache. StringTemplateHandler derived classes default to returning false to force no caching.

onServeHeaders

public HttpResponse onServeHeaders(long id,
                                   com.sun.net.httpserver.HttpExchange ex,
                                   Request request)
Description copied from interface: HttpHandleable
Called as the server is about to perform a GET. May be used by an overiding class to modify the response headers. The overiding class should return a HttpResponse or null to use the default HttpResponse.
NOTE: If the overiding class is going to alter the response body using onGETBody then it should set the Content-Length header in this method.

Specified by:
onServeHeaders in interface HttpHandleable
Overrides:
onServeHeaders in class StringTemplateHandler
Parameters:
id - Unique transaction id
ex - The exchange instance for the current HTTP transaction.
request - The request instance
Returns:
Return null to process normally, otherwise return a new HttpResponse to be send to the client

onHandlePost

public java.lang.Object onHandlePost(long id,
                                     com.sun.net.httpserver.HttpExchange ex,
                                     Request request,
                                     HttpResponse response,
                                     java.io.File dir,
                                     java.lang.Object... extraParameters)
Description copied from interface: Postable
Called when the server is about to perform a POST. May be used by an overiding class to generate dynamic content. The overiding class should return a new File or if it does not handle the post then it should return null. The resulting file will be processed as a GET request,

Specified by:
onHandlePost in interface Postable
Overrides:
onHandlePost in class StringTemplateHandler
Parameters:
id - Unique transaction id
ex - The HttpExchange instance for this request.
request - The Request
response - Response instance
dir - - Directory where output can be created
extraParameters - Extra parameters that can be used by overiding classes
Returns:
return either an HttpResponse instance or a new File instance within the base directory structure of the Httpd instance. If a File is returned it will be processed as a GET request.

templateFile

public java.io.File templateFile(org.antlr.stringtemplate.StringTemplate template,
                                 Request request,
                                 java.lang.StringBuffer mimeType,
                                 java.io.File dir)
Description copied from class: StringTemplateHandler
The method processes templates and returns the file generated from the template. The default behaviour when this class is the template processor is to load a class from m_templateJavaPackage with the same name as the template. This class must have an empty public constructor and must implement the Templatable interface. Overiding classes can modify this behaviour to change the way templates content is generated.

Specified by:
templateFile in interface Templatable
Overrides:
templateFile in class StringTemplateHandler
Parameters:
template - The template
request - The Request instance.
mimeType - Return the mime type of the generated content in this. parameter. NOTE: Can be null so check to avoid Exceptions
dir - Directory in which to create return file. Can be null
Returns:
The file generated from the template.

                                       Request request,
                                       java.lang.StringBuffer mimeType)
Description copied from class: StringTemplateHandler
The method processes templates and returns the file generated from the template. The default behaviour when this class is the template processor is to load a class from m_templateJavaPackage with the same name as the template. This class must have an empty public constructor and must implement the Templatable interface. Overiding classes can modify this behaviour to change the way templates content is generated.

Specified by:

Overrides:
templateString in class StringTemplateHandler
Parameters:
template - The template
request - The Request instance.
mimeType - Return the mime type of the generated content in this. parameter. NOTE: Can be null so check to avoid Exceptions

templateStream

public java.io.InputStream templateStream(org.antlr.stringtemplate.StringTemplate template,
                                          Request request,
                                          java.lang.StringBuffer mimeType)
Description copied from class: StringTemplateHandler
The method processes templates and returns the file generated from the template. The default behaviour when this class is the template processor is to load a class from m_templateJavaPackage with the same name as the template. This class must have an empty public constructor and must implement the Templatable interface. Overiding classes can modify this behaviour to change the way templates content is generated. Note With the current implementation only templateString (and templateFile for POST processing) is used so this method need not be implemented, although if the implementation changes for example to use chunked encoding and not to generate a string in onServeHeaders, but instead to generate a stream in onServeBody then templateStream would be required.

Specified by:
templateStream in interface Templatable
Overrides:
templateStream in class StringTemplateHandler
Parameters:
template - The template
request - The Request instance.
mimeType - Return the mime type of the generated content in this. parameter. NOTE: Can be null so check to avoid Exceptions
Returns:
The InputStream generated from the template.
